text:
Hi,

I'm just wondering if I have Group A (N=20) and group B (N=1), does it valid to do a statistical test, such as (independent) Wilcoxon rank sums or independent t-test?

Given that these tests works on class distribution, it seems that it wouldn't be correct to draw class distribution from only 1 sample. Any thoughts?

Thanks

elements.text:
Hi,

I'm just wondering if I have Group A (N=20) and group B (N=1), does it valid to do a statistical test, such as (independent) Wilcoxon rank sums or independent t-test?

Given that these tests works on class distribution, it seems that it wouldn't be correct to draw class distribution from only 1 sample. Any thoughts?

Thanks

text:
With that little data, you will need to make some assumption about A. if you believe A is normally distributed you can do
```HypothesisTests.OneSampleTTest(A,B)```

elements.text: With that little data, you will need to make some assumption about A. if you believe A is normally distributed you can do

text:
If you think A comes from another distribution, like Poisson you could do:
```HypothesisTests.ExactOneSampleKSTest([B], Distributions.Poisson(mean(A)))```
